alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 6:27PM EDT until August 04 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Cumberland County in south central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania... Central Huntingdon County in central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Juniata County in central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Mifflin County in central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Perry County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 627 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mount Union, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Shippensburg, Mount Union, Newville, Rockhill Furnace, Raystown Dam, Roxbury, Perulack, Big Spring State Park, Doylesburg, Mapleton, Orbisonia and Mill Creek. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 194 to 216. Interstate 81 from mile markers 23 to 30. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Stay inside a well built structure and keep away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this severe thunderstorm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Franklin; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Perry
